result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam G. Cantrell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
++  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges &   Domestic Violence Surcharge ($100.00  ea applicable count).  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
++  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.The court has no objection to early discharge from probation if deft completes recommended treatment; no objection to deft being present for the birth of his child.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adam G. Cantrell

records.addlTxt: Terminated-Regular

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: From Public Defender stating their repreentation has ended and they closed their case.
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State. Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney H Edwards. Clerk/H. Barnett. State's motion to revoke HOA. Atty Edwards does not oppose motion. Court revokes the HOA and finds deft guilty. Victim present and addressed. Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 1 year w/conditions; deft to submit DNA sample and pay $200 DNA surcharge, pay $100 DV surcharge, bond applied to costs, any remainder of bond to be returned to poster. The court has no objection to early discharge from probation if deft completes recommended treatment; no objection to deft being present for the birth of his child.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State. Atty H Edwards appeared on behalf of deft, who did not appear. Clerk/H. Barnett. Atty Edwards states the deft is at work. Motion to revoke HOA set for 1/9/18 at 9:30am. Bond continued.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Based on documentation showing that the deft is enrolled in the Circle of Change program and by agreement of ADA Phan and Atty Edwards, the MH of 8/23/17 at 1:15pm is removed from the calendar.
from Kimberly Rossi/Women & Children's Horizons.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State. Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney H Edwards. Clerk/H. Barnett. Atty Edwards states the deft has enrolled in the Circle of Change program. State's motion to revoke HOA set for 8/23/17 at 1:15pm; RH set for 1/8/18 at 1:15pm. Bond continued.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Attorney H Edwards appeared on behalf of deft, who did not appear.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Edwards states the deft is at work today; is in the Circle of Change program.  State's motion to revoke HOA is set for 8/16/17 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.
to revoke the stipulated hold open agreement; filed by ADA Jennifer Phan.
Hold Open Agreement - 12 months.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney H Edwards.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court withholds entry of judgment and allows a hold open agreement to go forward.  RH 6/13/17 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney H Edwards.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Edwards reports that the case may resolve with a HOA.  PLEAH set for 6/9/16 at 2pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney H Edwards.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  For reasons set forth on the record, FPT continued to 5/16/16 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney H Edwards.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Edwards states she has not met w/deft in her office; needs to look into treatment options for deft.  FPT continued to 4/6/16 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.
Atty Edwards recently appointed to represent def.  Def.'s grandfather passed away and the funeral is 2/5/16.  At the request of Atty Edwards, FPT on 2/5/16 at 8:45 is changed to 2/24/16 at 8:30.
Filed by Atty H Edwards.
Atty  H Edwards.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
And demand for discovery - filed by ADA  C McNeill.
$500 deposited on 1/4/16
